articles.title: Russia's economy could spiral into depression under an EU oil embargo - Markets Insider
articles.description: Without European buyers, Russia would need to find somewhere to store or sell roughly 2.5 million barrels a day.
articles.content:
Germany's announcement this week that it's ready to stop buying Russian oil makes a sweeping European Union oil embargo much more likely which would have devastating consequences for Moscow.

articles.author: Kieren Williams, Aaron Morris
articles.title: Russian state TV simulates 'terrifying' nuclear strike on Europe amid World War 3 concerns - Chronicle Live
articles.description: Kremlin-backed TV in Russia simulated a nuclear strike on Paris, Berlin and London as presenters claimed there would be 'no survivors' and the missiles would obliterate European capitals in a number of minutes.
articles.content:
Russian State TV showed what would happen in the event of a terrifying nuclear strike on Europe, declaring that there would be 'no survivors' in a rant response to the UK's support for Ukraine.

articles.title: Serbia displays Chinese missiles amid concerns in Balkans - 9News
articles.description: The European nation's display of a new anti-aircraft missile system has raised concerns that fragile peace in the Balkans could be under threat.
